info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM IN WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS... At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chester, or 13 miles northwest of Westfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Huntington around 700 PM EDT. Russell and Montgomery around 705 PM EDT. Southampton and Westhampton around 710 PM EDT. Westfield, Northampton and Easthampton around 720 PM EDT. Holyoke around 725 PM EDT. South Hadley around 730 PM EDT. Springfield, Chicopee and Granby around 735 PM EDT. Ludlow, Wilbraham and Monson around 745 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for western and central Massachusetts.
